document.title: New York State P-12 Common Core Learning Standards for English Language Arts & Literacy

084BC991ADED45E39E9FAE1A8A7CD3D3.description: With prompting and support, use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to texts.

D35384161BBD4A2A9392E04390B0B96A.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing the same general action (e.g., walk, march, strut, prance) by acting out the meanings.

C3B8CACCD93844788DF3A2BFC78AE54B.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at school that are colorful).

1202763EF0474613BE2265C6D23A5F8F.description: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites ( e.g., up, down, stop, go, in, out).

96B6F9C608C04063A358DC9964734786.description: Sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) for understanding of the concepts the categories represent.

8E870BDF2BFD4D6B8058C32E0DD68197.description: With guidance and support, explore word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

6B186C99F41045A78D7595127B7A6E98.description: Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately (e.g., knowing duck is a bird and learning the verb to duck).

DE370FB87A8145ACBDE9A754BBA57802.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on pre-kindergarten reading and content.

9B5715ED454545E6BDA03880B16EC01B.description: Use knowledge of language and how language functions in different contexts

704BD1F534034457A9A259D7CDC03012.description: With guidance and support, attempt to spell simple words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of sound-letter relationships.

3B64CC19B57A4883903079C7A429DC89.description: Attempt to write a letter or letters to represent a word.

058630B3D2CB4E9591EF069CA0E70896.description: Capitalize the first letter in their name.

4876EE0970964838A1740320A859C023.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

ACD0107FA9F94BB49CADDB2BFA2CF809.description: With guidance and support, produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.

8824FC024EF94EDCBDBC678B7C70B9AA.description: In speech, use the most frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., to, from, in, out, on, off, for, of, by, with).

FF79A96A72BE404A8E5583C222BF3657.description: Understand and use question words (interrogatives) (e.g., who, what, where, when, why, how).

29F85A0FA77245B196430F2CF9A06E61.description: With guidance and support, form regular plural nouns orally by adding /s/ or /es/ (e.g., dog, dogs; wish, wishes) (orally).

8CF9ECA14E0C4D698AE86950AAED0B3F.description: Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs (orally).

92AC4F468FE7488A8631C09B2C474C4C.description: Print some upper- and lowercase letters.(e.g. letters in their name).

6AE07CE474E34AE09D9FA53137A36A24.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

0F2B8C5335244AD3A5750B43A5687BD6.description: Demonstrate an emergent ability to express thoughts, feelings and ideas.

6440A369731E421DA6B5DF0880AF2CC4.description: Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions as desired to provide additional detail.

46029F01F06E47A3A04DE04FE8EB6D02.description: Describe familiar people, places, things, and events and, with prompting and support, provide additional detail.

EC6896A4E63A475686308E62F496D586.description: With guidance and support, ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not understood.

57C3497EFA264921ABFFCE73EEF820DE.description: With guidance and support, confirm understanding of a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media by asking and answering questions about key details and requesting clarification if something is not understood.

B102363438E849D4BA9E602F3EDCFC07.description: Communicate with individuals from different cultural backgrounds.

C78CBDB2420043C7B527A0396640AF17.description: Engage in agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others and taking turns speaking about the topics and texts under discussion).

3BDD3AF61DAB4DA7ADD5A88AD7040786.description: With guidance and support, participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about pre-kindergarten topics and texts with peers and adults in small and large groups.

4735795AB2A1444A99E2AB5D4E95337D.description: Create and present a poem, dramatization, art work, or personal response to a particular author or theme studied in class, with prompting and support as needed.

C21E09C4525140D58E992942CB0FEE02.description: With guidance and support, recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

063A9D89794D4F8BAC96E6E7DDC90DE2.description: With guidance and support, participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a number of books by a favorite author and express opinions about them).

F7709B72D50B43B5899B2B507FCC1D39.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

6DCF9D81364D4C11BA415B45E69E23D9.description: With guidance and support, explore a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing; collaborate with peers.

98B1CC5E3ED34B59A4ED36CED3184B1C.description: With guidance and support, respond to questions and suggestions and add details to strengthen illustration or writing, as needed.

3B827A10F467498B9F8897751862C1AC.description: With prompting and support, use a combination of drawing, dictating, or writing to narrate a single event and provide a reaction to what happened.

E9CD5A3D0093419BB28FE6E72203BA7C.description: With prompting and support, use a combination of drawing, dictating, or writing to compose informative/explanatory texts in which they name what they are writing about and supply some information about the topic.

53B15440B88547E5981DE1110E3C638F.description: With prompting and support, use a combination of drawing, dictating, or writing to express an opinion about a book or topic (e.g., I like…. because…)

E10F4E837D58410FBC464BBE789E1B5A.description: Displays emergent reading behaviors with purpose and understanding (e.g., pretend reading).

9B6FEE43B81A45A9B18DF05D9753380D.description: Recognizes own name and common signs and labels in the environment.

407E953D4DD84822A6DB641A995FA0CC.description: With prompting and support, demonstrate one-to-one letter-sound correspondence by producing the primary sound of some consonants.

4ABEE7862D8C40BCA9153FD8B134EE8C.description: Demonstrate emergent phonics and word analysis skills.

DCB7BA920C454CA7B5D1BB5A45AAB83E.description: With support and prompting, isolate and pronounce the initial sounds in words.

AE0039FEAFA04D609C1A9614E080DD7A.description: Demonstrate awareness of relationship between sounds and letters.

4722044DE17F403B9B07FC615990D722.description: Recognize and match words that rhyme.

0C0410FE941D46329AD438E6718A415A.description: Engage in language play (e.g. alliterative language, rhyming, sound patterns).

FB654E40E0AB404A930B1A2C996CCE86.description: Demonstrate an emerging understanding of spoken words, syllables and sounds (phonemes).

C56F4EF20C9E42459F333BD943F08D07.description: Recognize that letters are grouped to form words.

44ED3A1BAD1E4D65A77462DC6731C1B0.description: Recognize and name some upper /lowercase letters of the alphabet, especially those in own name.

D953FD8447C94E0F830DE694239E460C.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

D8B81F739A994369A84C77D0965F1270.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

EE217EA2631C4076BC009976DC9A8C0E.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

E84A7ED8B69844828DE824AAF77B733A.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

F3F2B6BFC95545E9942F0B35BEFD23EB.description: With prompting and support, actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

B2DDFA6F4AE04390A6C895228B29569B.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

C781DC98DE5A42A3A0F272C2D6FDDF02.description: With prompting and support, identify basic similarities and differences between two texts on the same topic (e.g. illustrations, descriptions or procedures).

275B61732C2F4DD2929870AFEABE0421.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the text in which they appear (e.g. what person, place, thing or idea in the text an illustration depicts).

D5AA0DE3D7A84CC2A9EB036D708E7149.description: With prompting and support, can describe the role of an author and illustrator.

C79D2EDBEAE34242949D979452E3C332.description: Identify the front cover, back cover; displays correct orientation of book, page turning skills.

3B008AFE8B5C4547ACF702C78A462583.description: Exhibit curiosity and interest in learning new vocabulary (e.g., ask questions about unfamiliar vocabulary).

8DEDB23DFED845FD9771DA4A9F6F1A63.description: With prompting and support, describe the connection between two events or pieces of information in a text.

66CA27EFAB124EB491DE9C29199493A7.description: With prompting and support, retell detail(s) in a text.

27E53EF9FA7C445CA7B133EF4D72E14F.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about details in a text.

C35EE46A236B48368F9D68F0B13E4BBA.description: With prompting and support, make connections between self, text, and the world around them (text, media, social interaction).

32808E718C4244A1AC02204C41BA4E1B.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

4E863E93E7F841F484F28DBCA91F2803.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

E9D9B5DC4FAA461681243E61F40B5808.description: With prompting and support, students will make cultural connections to text and self.

C89BC83F356C4153A1B7AAB2FEE65FAB.description: With prompting and support, students will compare and contrast two stories relating to the same topic.

2CBB87CEC4324E18ADF0DCF6BD3FD9BA.description: With prompting and support, students will engage in a picture walk to make connections between self, illustrations, and the story.

A53A5D1D843E4D148E1B1E60D7A424B0.description: With prompting and support, can describe the role of an author and illustrator.

FA081CECBE31490DA3ADD24E11DD46AB.description: Students interact with a variety of common types of texts (e.g., storybooks, poems, songs).

2A356C255DA94746A2542C311F7E96DE.description: Exhibit curiosity and interest in learning new vocabulary (e.g., ask questions about unfamiliar vocabulary).

7A3A93B7DB6048F7BFF4CEFFCAED46CD.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about characters and major events in a story.

CB1AB85A4B274C939E5EDB9A84BE66BF.description: With prompting and support, retell familiar stories.

046681FCE55D413FBD739B597FC2ADAF.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer about detail(s) in a text.
